# Behandlung fehlender Werte
anosCuad <- aggregate(dfSurvey['anos_escolaridad'],
          by = list(dfSurvey$cuadrantes),
          FUN = median,
          na.rm = TRUE,
          na.action = na.pass)

Mode2 <- function(x) {tab <- table(x); names(tab)[which.max(tab)]}
#Quelle: https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/r-help/2010-March/231975.html 

aggregate(dfSurvey[c('asis_esc', 'habl_ind')],
          by = list(dfSurvey$cuadrantes),
          FUN = Mode2)

dfSurvey$asis_esc[which(is.na(dfSurvey$asis_esc))] <- 'Ja'
dfSurvey$habl_ind[which(is.na(dfSurvey$habl_ind))] <- 'Nein'

for (i in c('extrem','gemildert','anfällig aufgrund Einkommen', 'anfällig aufgrund Sozialmangel', 'keine')) {
    
    dfSurvey$anos_escolaridad[which(is.na(dfSurvey$anos_escolaridad) &
                           dfSurvey$cuadrantes == i)] <- anosCuad[which(anosCuad == i),2]
    
}

rm(i)
rm(Mode2)

dfSurvey <- na.omit(dfSurvey)

# dfSurvey$edad <- (dfSurvey$edad-min(dfSurvey$edad))/(max(dfSurvey$edad)-min(dfSurvey$edad))

```{r Multimomiale logistische Regression}
# Datensatz in Trainings- und Testdatendatz splitten
library(caTools)
set.seed(123)
split = sample.split(dfSurvey$cuadrantes, SplitRatio = 0.75)
trainingSurvey = subset(dfSurvey, split == TRUE)
testSurvey = subset(dfSurvey, split == FALSE)

# multlogReg modellieren (anhand Trainingsdatensatz)
library(nnet)
fullMLR <- multinom(cuadrantes ~ ., data = trainingSurvey)
AICMLR <- step(fullMLR, direction = 'backward', trace = 0)

fullMLR$vcoefnames[which(!(fullMLR$vcoefnames %in% AICMLR$vcoefnames))]

#y_hat <- ifelse(y_prob < 0.5, 0 , 1 )

# Vorhersage (anhand Testdatensatz)
y_pred_MLR <- predict(AICMLR, newdata = testSurvey[-1])
#y_pred <- ifelse(y_pred < 0.5, 0 , 1 )

# Making the Confusion Matrix
confMat_MLR = table(testSurvey[,1], y_pred_MLR)

# Genauigkeit
accuracy_MLR <- sum(diag(confMat_MLR))/sum(confMat_MLR)
```


```{r SVM}
# Fitting SVM to the Training set
#install.packages("e1071")
library(e1071)

#tune <- tune.svm(cuadrantes ~ ., data = trainingSurvey, gamma =seq(.01, 0.1), cost = seq(0.1,1))
#tune <- tune.svm(cuadrantes ~ ., data = trainingSurvey, gamma =seq(.01, 0.1, by = .01), cost = seq(0.1,1, by = 0.1))

classifierSVM <- svm(cuadrantes ~ .,
                  data = trainingSurvey,
                  type = "C-classification",
                  kernel = "radial")
                  #, gamma = tune$best.parameters$gamma, cost = tune$best.parameters$cost)

# Predicting the Test set results
y_pred_SVM = predict(classifierSVM, newdata = testSurvey[-1])

# Making the Confusion Matrix
confMat_SVM = table(true = testSurvey[,1], pred = y_pred_SVM)

# Genauigkeit
accuracy_SVM <- sum(diag(confMat_SVM))/sum(confMat_SVM)
```
